urls.title: #ICA21: I'm Excited For....
urls.description: 1. THIS YEAR'S THEME "Engaging the Essential Work of Care: Communication, Connectedness, and Social Justice" -- When the ICA 2021 organizing committee (Mary Beth Oliver, Mohan Dutta, Meghan Sanders, Walid Afifi, Chenjerai Kumanyika, and myself) discussed and debated the theme for this year, we had no idea how it would be received. But it not just resonated with everyone but continues to be relevant in this world of continued COVID-19 (and other) inequalities. 2. OUR NEW ICA PRESIDENT! All I can

tweets.text: Last, but certainly not least, @QiankunZhong uses costless signaling theory to formally model circumstances when, in both single and repeated interaction, people are likely to share honest information #ICA21 https://t.co/2un647bBq2 https://t.co/n5qWjnyWLG

.@yoojungerikaoh's presentation places information theory on a biological foundation. In doing so, she provides a path forward for researchers looking to test one of our field's oldest theories #ICA21 https://t.co/WFjg7Bgwn5

In a similar approach, @justinkeene and colleagues present a psychophysiological investigation into flow. The results illuminate the physiological dynamics underpinning flow experiences #ICA21 https://t.co/TV44H1HECJ https://t.co/LF3soxXmtX

Next, @GongXuanjun presents results from two studies using a multi-attribute computational model (the drift diffusion model) to formalize key predictions drawn from Mood Management Theory. Big thanks to @ulusoyez and @allison_eden! #ICA21 https://t.co/7ErVlWrylp https://t.co/KlNltMn3UV
